member.name: T:Gallio.PowerShellCommands.RunGallioCommand
member.summary: A PowerShell Cmdlet for running Gallio.

member.name: M:Gallio.PowerShellCommands.RunGallioCommand.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class

summary.para: Gets or sets the relative or absolute path of the application base directory, or null to use a default value selected by the consumer.
If relative, the path is based on the current working directory, so a value of "" causes the current working directory to be used.
Attaches the debugger to the test process when set to true.

member.name: P:Gallio.PowerShellCommands.RunGallioCommand.DoNotRun
member.summary: Sets whether to load the tests but not run them. This option may be used to produce a report that contains test metadata for consumption by other tools.

member.name: P:Gallio.PowerShellCommands.RunGallioCommand.Files
member.summary: The list of relative or absolute paths of test files, projects and assemblies to execute. Wildcards may be used. This is required.

summary.para: Sets the filter set to apply, which consists of a sequence of one or more inclusion or exclusion filter rules prefixed using 'include' (optional) or 'exclude'.

member.name: P:Gallio.PowerShellCommands.RunGallioCommand.HintDirectories
member.summary: The list of directories used for loading referenced assemblies and other dependent resources.

summary.para: Sets whether to ignore annotations when determining the result code. If false (default), then error annotations, usually indicative of broken tests, will cause a failure result to be generated.

member.name: P:Gallio.PowerShellCommands.RunGallioCommand.NoEchoResults
member.summary: Sets whether to echo results to the screen as tests finish. If this option is specified only the final summary statistics are displayed. Otherwise test results are echoed to the console in varying detail depending on the current verbosity level.

member.name: P:Gallio.PowerShellCommands.RunGallioCommand.PluginDirectories
member.summary: Additional Gallio plugin directories to search recursively.

member.name: P:Gallio.PowerShellCommands.RunGallioCommand.ReportDirectory
member.summary: Sets the name of the directory where the reports will be put.

member.name: P:Gallio.PowerShellCommands.RunGallioCommand.ReportFormatterProperties
member.summary: Specifies option property key/value pairs for the report formatter.

member.name: P:Gallio.PowerShellCommands.RunGallioCommand.ReportNameFormat
member.summary: Sets the format string to use to generate the reports filenames.

member.name: P:Gallio.PowerShellCommands.RunGallioCommand.ReportTypes
member.summary: A list of the types of reports to generate, separated by semicolons.

summary.para: Specifies the type, assembly, and parameters of custom test runner extensions to use during the test run in the form: '[Namespace.]Type,Assembly[;Parameters]'.

member.name: P:Gallio.PowerShellCommands.RunGallioCommand.RunnerProperties
member.summary: Specifies option property key/value pairs for the test runner.

member.name: P:Gallio.PowerShellCommands.RunGallioCommand.RunnerType
member.summary: Sets the type of test runner to use.

member.name: P:Gallio.PowerShellCommands.RunGallioCommand.RunTimeLimit
member.summary: Sets the maximum amount of time (in seconds) the tests can run before they are canceled. The default is an infinite time to run.

summary.para: Gets or sets the version of the .Net runtime to use for running tests.
For the CLR, this must be the name of one of the framework directories in %SystemRoot%\Microsoft.Net\Framework. eg. 'v2.0.50727'.
The default is null which uses the most recent installed and supported framework.
Enables shadow copying when set to true.
Shadow copying allows the original assemblies to be modified while the tests are running. However, shadow copying may occasionally cause some tests to fail if they depend on their original location.

member.name: P:Gallio.PowerShellCommands.RunGallioCommand.ShowReports
member.summary: Sets whether to open the generated reports once execution has finished.

summary.para: Gets or sets the relative or absolute path of the working directory or null to use a default value selected by the consumer.
If relative, the path is based on the current working directory, so a value of "" causes the current working directory to be used.
